result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathon F. Quartullo Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF415 & 15CF417 called together at 1:24 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jonathon F. Quartullo in court, in-custody, with Attorney Samantha Jeanne Humes. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Humes submits plea paperwork along with letter in support of Defendant; ADA Teuber submits victim impact statement for case 15CF417
BOTH CASES: Service of the information admitted; reading waived

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "Guilty" entered Count #1-15CF415 & Count #1-15CF417; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.

On Count #1-15CF417, the Court sentences Mr. Quartullo to 6 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 3 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years, concurrent. This sentence is to commence concurrent to any previously imposed sentence.

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 34 days credit for time already served

On Count #1-15CF415, the Court IMPOSES & STAYS 10 YEARS PRISON, CONSECUTIVE TO CONSIST OF 7 YEARS INITIAL CONFINEMENT AND 3 YEARS EXTENDED SUPERVISION and places the Defendant on probation for 6 years, concurrent, with conditions:

If revoked, The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision and probation:
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--Take prescribed medications as prescribed
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No presence at Garden Path Floral in Watertown, WI
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--Random drug screening
 as directed by DOC
--No acts/threats of violence
--No possession of drug paraphernalia including needles/syringes without a valid prescription
--To pay restitution of $500, payable to Garden Path Floral (15CF417)
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee (15CF417)
--No contact with Calvin Rosser

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Recess: 2:00 pm
Arraignment on June 2, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Current: PO BOX 147, Attn: Records #503141, Fox Lake, WI 53933 United States  (Effective: 05-03-2016)
Prior: ATTN: Jailer, PO BOX 200, Fox Lake, WI 53933 United States

records.addlTxt:
[Prior to Heairng//Off Recors: ADA Hall indicates that there is victim rights compliance to call cases early]]

Cases 15CF415 and 15CF417 called together at 10:29am 
Defendant Jonathon F. Quartullo in court, in custody with Attorney Samantha Jeanne Humes.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO BOTH CASES:
Mr.Quartullo   waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Atty. Humes submits a request for substitution in each file
ADA Hall submits an Information in each file


The Court finds the request is timely and in the proper form. The Court directs the Clerk to request the assignment of another Judge under Wis. Stat. 751.03
Atty. Humes updates Mr. Quartullo's address to Fox Lake Correctional Institute.

NEXT:   The Court directs the Clerk to request the assignment of another Judge under Wis. Stat. 751.03

Status conference at 05-03-2016 10:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 03-09-2016 10:20 am

Response advising bond request sent to wrong fax number
for Detainer
Conflict Review Worksheet - No conflict found
Conflict Review Worksheet - No conflict found
From Dodge Correctional

Cases 15CF415 and 15CF417 called together at 2:00pm [mo]
Defendant Jonathon F. Quartullo appears via video conferencing from DCI, in custody.
Attorney Samantha Jeanne Humes appears in court.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient.
The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr.Quartullo. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

The Court verifies date of birth on Criminal Complaints
Service of Complaints admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in each of the Criminal Complaints. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1000   Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription 

recess: 2:10 

NEXT:  As to Both Cases: (1) Pretrial Conference on  3/9/2016 at 10:20am  (2) Status Conference on 5/3/2016 at 10:30am
Attorney Humes
